text:
Hey Folks! Having some challenges importing a blog csv. Most of the images come back
`unable to download assets`
I spot-checked and they’re 200

So I’d like to understand how the overwrite feature works - If overwrite is on, what happens? Let’s say the matched post has no  featured image, but successfully imports, do I get an image there? Or if an image existed on the post, but the asset retrieval fails this time, do I lose the image I previously had on the post?

EDIT: grrrrr. it looks like ‘overwrite’ just overwrites, even if it’s wiping out existing images.  Are there any other tricks to getting these images imported, other than doing it manually? It’s a big blog.

Hey Tony, short answer is yes, if this is a wordpress site then HubSpot have an importer for wordpress blogs. You just need to map some elements depending on your needs. Doing it manually is not a practical way for big blogs sites.

unfortunately it’s adrupal 7 site. took me 3 hrs to export lol. And yes, I realize there are importers, I guess my issue is that everything is importing except the images, which are hit and miss. what’s the easiest way to batch all of these images in?
